intro: Crepis baldaccii subsp. carpinii, commonly known as the Carpinii mouse-ear, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in dry and sunny habitats. It produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is notable for its ecological adaptability and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
